This error has been seen when the user had Mozilla 1.7 with SWT 3.0.

Godis: there are a few things you can do around it.

1. First to avoid this crash, the simplest you can do is
open a terminal
setenv MOZILLA_FIVE_HOME ""  (for csh - use right command for other shells)
eclipse

This will cause the SWT Browser widget to not find and not use the Mozilla 1.7 
that causes trouble. The Browser widget will not come up but the rest of 
Eclipse should.

2. Mozilla 1.7 is supported in SWT 3.1 M4 and above. It will also be supported 
in maintainance build Eclipse 3.0.2. If you can switch to these versions, 
things should work.

3. If you must stay with the existing version of Eclipse and SWT, you can also 
install Mozilla 1.6GTK2 - that version works with SWT 3.0. The SWT FAQ "What 
do I need to run the SWT Browser inside Eclipse on Linux GTK or Linux Motif?" 
contains a link to download that version.
http://dev.eclipse.org/viewcvs/index.cgi/%7Echeckout%7E/platform-swt-
home/faq.html#browserlinux

Can you confirm the version of Mozilla you are using? Which Linux distribution?
Ok I just got the "GodisGreat" nickname...

Should be fixed with 3.1 M6, problem believe to be caused with unsupported 
Mozilla 1.7 in Eclipse 3.0
